text: Ann Karindi Mwangi (born 8 December 1988) is a Kenyan middle- and long- distance runner. She was a team gold medallist at the IAAF World Cross Country Championships in 2009 and represented her country at the 2011 All-Africa Games. From Nyahururu in Kenya's Laikipia County,Damary, Rita (2014-03-15). Wanjiku best in 10,000m at first AK meet in Nakuru. The Star. Retrieved on 2016-09-03. She moved to Japan and ran for the Toyota Industries corporate team. She set a stage record at the 2010 All-Japan Women's Corporate Ekiden Championships.Nakamura, Ken (2010-12-19). Tenmaya team wins Japanese Corp Women's Ekiden Champs . IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-09-03. Running for Kenya, she won her first major medal at the 2009 IAAF World Cross Country Championships. In seventh place, she took the women's team title with the help of Florence Kiplagat, Linet Masai and Lineth Chepkurui.Ann Karindi Mwangi. IAAF. Retrieved on 2016-09-03. She won the Cross Zornotza the following year and had her first top level road win in Japan at the Sanyo Women's 10K.Shigenobu Ota et al. (2013-12-27). Sanyo Women's Half Marathon. Association of Road Racing Statisticians. Retrieved on 2014-02-22.Gasparovic, Juraj (2011-01-10). Cross Zornotza. Association of Road Racing Statisticians. Retrieved on 2011-01-21. She began to focus more on middle-distance after 2009. She was sixth in the 1500 metres at both the 2010 African Championships in Athletics and the 2011 All-Africa Games. She helped set a world record in the 4 × 1500 metres relay event. Running in a team with Mercy Cherono, Irene Jelagat, and Perin Nenkampi, the women took two seconds off the previous best at 17:05.72 minutes.Mutuota, Mutwiri (2014-04-27). Women's 4x1500m world record for Kenyan quartet. IAAF.
